attributes.action: Include Black History in the education curriculum in History from year 9 to 13
attributes.additional_details: This is because not many students are educated on Black history and are not seeing the problem in being racist and calling names, I believe that putting this into the curriculum students will be more aware of the struggles that Black People have gone through. A small assembly on racism will not help students to see the real problem and history in why we shouldn't be racist. As these issues are never handled with so by putting this into the curriculum, everyone will be more aware.
attributes.background: To educate students on Black History from years 9 to 13 in The History curriculum. And to include this in GCSE and A level History.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make the teaching of Black history compulsory in primary and secondary schools: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583892

Decolonise the UK curriculum and make it more diverse: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581666
